How We Treat Do Not Track Signals/California Do Not Track Disclosure

Various browsers allow a “do not track” (DNT) setting that relies on a technology known as a DNT header, which sends a signal to websites visited by the individual about the individual’s browser DNT setting. At this time, there is no general agreement on how companies like Twilio should interpret Do Not Track signals. Therefore, Twilio does not currently commit to respond to DNT signals, whether that signal is received on a computer or on a mobile device.
